title: Opening new tab automatically clicking search bar
content: When I press ctrl-t, it normally opens a new tab, with the search bar automatically activated so I can immediately type in a website. When I am watching a video in full screen and press ctrl-t, the search bar is not automatically selected, and I have to click it to search something. Is there a fix for this?
creator: ezlerner51

title: Opening firefox is just blank white screen even when opening it in safe mode
content: Opening firefox is just a blank white screen without borders (screenshot 1) Apparently it seems it didn't hang and it I can determine the location of the URL bar by hover the mouse and can click the location of the close button to close the window This is different from most issues since they can open it in Safe mode I can't even open in safe mode since it also shows a blank white screen (screenshot 2) I already tried uninstall and reinstalling with fresh settings but nothing works
creator: wasd2k6

title: Pop up ad causes site to freeze
content: There's a problem with the site filmcomment.com that only happens on Firefox and not other browsers. As of today, when I load the site an ad pops up for a newsletter. I click the X and the text of the ad goes away, but the screen remains dark and the site is unusable. I have turned off all ad blocking for this site and have tried clearing cookies.
creator: cplester110

title: Autoplay continues despite setting permission to block and also trying extensions
content: I cannot stop autoplay of audio/video on numerous sites despite setting permission to block all. Also tried several extensions. This seemed to have happened a couple if updates ago. Currently using 88.0.1

creator: nirbok0851

title: Trying to add a PKI root certficate
content:
This is the first time I've needed to do this in years but, at one time, installing a root (or, for that matter, third-level) CA certificate in Firefox was straightforward. Unless I'm missing something --and I've been poking around these files for over an hour-- it is now, at best, quite obscure. Is there a way for me to install a CA certificate for a CA you have chosen to not recognize and include with the system? If so, a clear explanation of how to do it would be appreciated. And, yes, I understand the implications of doing this.

Thanks.
creator: klensin+mozilla

title: Print Previews taking up to a minute to process
content:
